6.29.25  11:54 pm   How do get better at switching chords on the piano?

Â Â Â Â Â  start by just switching notes. keep doing that until you automatically go for the ones you want based on the way you know they sound. how to accomplish this? spend hours upon hours playing, essentially using childhood playground tactics. no one is telling you what you want. fortunately the piano happens to be a miracle tool for that purpose

6.29.25  6:35 am   I often times get mildly annoyed when certain songs set themselves up to "transcend" but then... they don't end up transcending. What I mean by transcending is difficult to put in to words, it's something like when a comedian is telling an elaborate joke, the crowd is already dying with laughter BUT THEN he goes even further that noone could've anticipated - like that but just in musical form. Whenever that happens, I often just pause the song and imagine in my mind how I would transcend the song, and then I end up wondering why the artist didn't transcend it like that, or why they didn't transcend it at all. Can you relate to some of this mild annoyance?

Â Â Â Â Â  maybe they aren't capable of doing it like you could do it. or, maybe they transcended in a different way and you just didn't follow it. or, maybe they did not actually think they were 'setting themselves up to transcend.' so many different ways for this to play out, but the underlying factor is simply that we're not all on the exact same trip at each given time. it's kind of a miracle that music ever even connects to anyone at all. which is why i am hesitant to place blame when it doesnt, even if the 'problem' may seem so clear to me at a certain point in time. the best thing here is probably to save it for your own work. and actually the fact that you're feeling this critique, this can be seen as a mounting desire for you to make your own music

6.29.25  5:18 am   do you think trigonometry is interesting? i fuckin hate it

Â Â Â Â Â  that means you're doing it at the wrong time. For example, have you ever tried to eat a huge meal when you absolutely were not hungry? that being said it's interesting you mention that because i'm super hungry for trigonometry right now. actually that's not true, actually i'm hungry for calculus, but i need to go through trig because that's one of the keys to opening the door of calculus. that being said, if you are not currently hungry for trig nor calculus, then both are going to have a very uncomfortable nauseating effect

6.29.25  2:55 am   is there anything you think no one should miss doing at least once?

Â Â Â Â Â  no. perscribing things for other people is tedious enough without trying to also make sure it's appropriate for every person in existence. Actually, it's reminding me of some of the best stories and tales: person misses unmissable thing; watch it unfold and all the amazing ways they cope

6.29.25  2:42 am   how much work do you think people would actually end up getting done if distractions didnt distract?

i feel like we could probably build a couple rockets to the moon

Â Â Â Â Â  it would add up to the same amount. if you werent 'distracted' from thing A with thing B, you'd work on thing A more, but thing B less. in your example, for example, if rocket building has been distracting you from something else, then with 'no distractions' that means no rocket building for you

6.28.25  2:28 pm   what is the simulation of

Â Â Â Â Â  it should specify in the words just before the word 'simulation'. for example, horse riding simulation would be a simulation of horse riding. and so on. if no description is given, then i think you need to ask for more detailed elaboration in order to have any idea what the flipping heck you are actually talking about

6.28.25  1:14 pm   when im around people i think i show my cards a little too much. i don't think it necessarily makes the conversation bad, but it certainly devalues information about myself. like, if im a building, it just keeps getting smaller or the walls busted out, and the architecture steadily gets way less interesting. buildings are cool when they have a clear structure that everyone can see, and then there are doors to particular rooms that only certain people can go in.

Â Â Â Â Â  yes i can see how overexposure could devalue something. this reminds me of a realization i had about my question answering, somewhere within the first few months. and adjusted accordingly and felt a nice improvement because of that adjustment. in fact, ever since that adjustment, what i always find myself doing is answering something clearly and completely and then go back and realize that it shines way brighter with only about half that, and basically just delete the second half. happens all the time. that being said, i'm not sure that applies exactly to this question, until i said this and now it does, until i said that and now it doesnt, until i said that and of course now it doesnt again and now it really doesnt. but then of course now it does again. thanks for reading

6.28.25  3:44 am   do you think apathy is the source of all bad things

6.28.25  3:12 am   my dad always said a couple is 2, a few is 3-6 and several is 7+.  I ignored most everything my parents ever said to me but for some reason I internalized that hard.  even if it's definitely different from what most people mean by 'several'

Â Â Â Â Â  well, try doing something for 4 days and see if that feels like several days to you. on paper, the word 'several' may look like 'seven', but go and see what the experience counts for. also this raises an interesting issue which is 'several' things are likely to be part of a sequence. if you have 7 items all at once, i almost think that might be called a 'bunch'. but it also depends on the size of the item and what the reasonable quantities are. for example if you had some grains of rice in a bag and you poured about 23 grains onto a plate, you can easily call that a few. it wouldn't really feel like 'several' unless you took them out one at a time

6.28.25  1:56 am   why do well-known scientists keep lapsing into pseudoscience every now and then, specifically when it's least expected? even the ones that don't seem to care about fame and don't let it get to them?

Â Â Â Â Â  sometimes imagination is the only way to discover anything new. like when rowing a boat, the oars do need to go outside the boat partially
